By James Clay

University reports are not the way forward

By combining "University Life" together in a six page booklet we are in effect undermining a hard-earned educational qualification which should stand for itself

I have nothing but bad advice for the young

If I could do it all again, I think I'd have to do it the same way, but with gritted teeth and a sense of deep embarrassment

Changing student politics for the better

We should stir up debate, invite speakers onto campus, put ideas out there, provide openings for you guys to hold to account those who make decisions, and share your ideas, and let them know what you think

Don't turn into fresh meat

A campus university can seem reasonably cosy and secure, but once freshers break out of the microcosm, and take a taxi straight into the real World, it seems they'll now have to be on guard at all times

HIV awareness campaigns should raise awareness

It confuses me why some MSM targeted awareness campaigns treat life with the virus as a walk in the park

Rankings show patterns, not attainment

The senior team within our establishment cannot have it both ways

Hes East: the significant other

The University must continue to invest in student facilities to make the second campus feel like a student campus

Night-time staffing a vital support

We are attending a quality University, and that should be reflected in it's welfare provisions as well as it's degree scores

Postgrad Freshers

If you feel anxious at any point that you aren't doing enough to make more friends, the chances are you shouldn't be

Left wing or left behind?

There are left-wing students at York, just as there are at any university, but the number is not so great to justify the myopias of the curriculum

Positively discriminating students

In my opinion, we need a system which ensures all students have an equal - and high - standard of primary and secondary education so that college and university places can fairly be awarded based solely on academic success

Taking lessons from Sheffield

Last week, as the results of the National Student Survey were released, it became clearer than ever that in order to make YUSU more efficient, it needed to transition from an introverted administrative organisation, into a more transparent and engaging entity

Banter!

Today's banter isn't about being witty, it's about having an excuse for being as horribly offensive as is humanly possible (Thumbnail credit Frankie Boyle, credit: Last FM)

A fresh view: leaving a small town

I'm going to be at the other end of the country, in a city that I've decided is right for me because I'm studying history and I like 'old stuff'

Keeping the boobs at bay

I'm sure it would make me uncomfortable if I saw my girlfriend or wife gawping at a naked picture of a man sporting weaponry equally large and malformed as Page 3 'beauties' breasts

Advertising, brands, and children

Not all products are evil, but the unique psychology of young people is being exploited in the name of profit through the endless flow of advertisements and marketing.

The new orientalism

The observation of young Muslims - once the principal drivers of the revolution - chanting angry slogans and burning flags, illustrated nothing more than the ashes of hopeful optimism, scorched by the flames of a volatile religious ideology

Be curious

The stories of how many of the athletes became disabled through birth, injury or illness is what's captured the hearts of the nation, but not through pity (Thumbnail credit Simmonds and Pistorius, Credit: Nick J Webb )

Invest in an internship

We're constantly told that interning is fast becoming a gauntlet students are obliged to run, unless we fancy sharing a measly dole with those ravenous hidden costs

Pride Sells

It is important to remember that before all the sponsorship, the shameful doping and even the fickle press the games were for one purpose only, Glory (Thumbnail credit A BA Olympic advert. Credit: British Airways)

Shop 'til you drop

The global economy is absolutely obsessed and dependent on growth

Citizen cliche

Not only because some of the scenarios felt as if they'd escaped from a Carry On film or that the show looked as if it had been filmed through Instagram, but because the modern day British- Asian family has moved on in leaps and bounds since then

ure, being right next to the sports centre sounded like a brilliant idea, but the guilt it would inflict as I simply walked past it everyday to buy the all-important pre-drinks would be unbearable

A fresh view: my first budget

Seizing the nearest pen and paper I can find, I decide to budget - because that seems like something a responsible student would do.

The temperature has been raised in the already heated debate on so-called 'designer babies', as an Oxford University academic publically pledged his support for embryo screening of personality traits. Alex Slingsby discusses the potential impacts of such selections on our future generations. (Thumbnail credit Photo Credit: Carl Zeiss Microscopy)

26 minutes. Not much you might think, but it was plenty of time to worry about not getting into university
